name: Flux - AI-Powered Brand Asset Platform
description: A competitive analysis-informed PRD for a creative collaboration tool that combines the best features of Figma Buzz, Weavy.ai, Canva, and Adobe Express to create resilient, market-ready creative software.

figma_buzz.overview: Launched May 2025 at Config, Figma Buzz enables design and marketing teams to co-create branded assets within the Figma ecosystem.
key_features: Template-based creation with locked/editable zones for brand consistency
Bulk asset generation from spreadsheet data (CSV/Excel mapping)
AI integration with gpt-image-1 and Gemini for image generation
Multiple canvas views (Asset View for detail, Grid View for overview)
Pre-built social platform formats (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.)
Copy-paste integration from Figma Design files
Background removal, image combination, resolution boost
Text rewriting, shortening, and translation via AI
strengths: Deep ecosystem integration with Figma Design
Brand consistency through design system enforcement
Free during beta, included in paid Figma plans
40% reduction in redundant asset requests (Affirm case study)
weaknesses: No CMYK color profiles for print
No PDF export with bleed and cutlines
Smaller template library compared to Canva
figma_buzz.pricing: Free (included in Full, Dev, and Content seats)

weavy_ai.overview: Node-based AI design platform aggregating multiple AI models for creative professionals.
key_features: Multi-model AI integration (Black Forest Labs, Runway, Google, Stability AI)
Professional editing tools (layers, masking, inpainting, upscaling)
App Mode for simplified team UIs from complex workflows
Text, image, video, and 3D generation capabilities
weaknesses: Steeper learning curve for node-based interface
Credit-based system can be unpredictable for budgeting

canva.overview: Market-leading design tool for quick content creation, known for massive template library and ease of use.
key_features: Print-ready exports with CMYK and bleed
strengths: Lowest barrier to entry for non-designers
weaknesses: Not integrated with professional design systems

adobe_express.overview: Adobe's simplified creative tool integrated with Creative Cloud ecosystem.

ecosystem_integration.description: Tools that integrate deeply with existing workflows (Figma Design, Adobe CC) create switching costs and become essential infrastructure.
ecosystem_integration.implementation: Build bidirectional sync with design systems, import/export with major tools, API-first architecture

brand_consistency_enforcement.description: Locked editable zones, design tokens, and brand guidelines prevent off-brand content while enabling team velocity.
brand_consistency_enforcement.implementation: Template builder with locked/editable regions, automatic brand asset injection, style guide enforcement

ai_first_architecture.description: Generative AI for images, text, and video is table stakes. Multi-model support provides flexibility and future-proofing.
ai_first_architecture.implementation: Aggregate top models (Flux, Runway, Gemini, GPT), provide model selection per task, support fine-tuned brand models

collaboration_primitives.description: Real-time editing, commenting, approval workflows, and team libraries reduce friction in content production.
collaboration_primitives.implementation: Real-time cursors, threaded comments, approval states, shared asset libraries, notification integrations

bulk_operations.description: Data-driven asset generation from spreadsheets enables marketing campaigns at scale.
bulk_operations.implementation: CSV/Excel import, column-to-template mapping, batch generation, variant management

platform_presets.description: Pre-configured dimensions for social platforms eliminate manual resizing and format research.
platform_presets.implementation: One-click resize, intelligent content reflow, platform-specific export optimizations

non_designer_accessibility.description: Marketing teams need to self-serve without design bottlenecks while staying on-brand.
non_designer_accessibility.implementation: Simplified editing modes, guardrailed templates, AI assistance for non-designers

offline_capability.description: Work without connectivity, sync when online. Critical for reliability and trust.
offline_capability.implementation: Local-first architecture, optimistic UI, background sync, conflict resolution

stories.title: Project initialization with Next.js 16
stories.description: Bootstrap the Flux application with modern web stack optimized for real-time collaboration and AI integration.
acceptance: Next.js 16 app created using: bunx create-next-app@latest app --ts --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-bun --yes
Biome configured: cd app && bun add -d @biomejs/biome && bunx @biomejs/biome init
Tailwind v4 with CSS-first configuration and design tokens
shadcn/ui initialized with New York style
PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM for multi-tenant data
Real-time infrastructure (Socket.io or Liveblocks) configured
AI SDK installed (Vercel AI SDK with multi-provider support)

stories.title: Team authentication and workspace management
stories.description: Implement secure authentication with team/workspace support for brand isolation.
acceptance: OAuth providers (Google, Microsoft, GitHub) via NextAuth.js
Workspace creation with team invites
Role-based access (Admin, Designer, Editor, Viewer)
Workspace isolation for brand assets and templates
SSO support for enterprise customers

stories.title: Brand Kit configuration
stories.description: Enable teams to configure brand assets, colors, fonts, and guidelines that enforce consistency across all generated content.
acceptance: Logo upload with automatic background removal
Primary, secondary, and accent color palette definition
Font family upload and configuration (heading, body, accent)
Brand voice guidelines for AI text generation
Asset library for approved images and icons
Export brand kit as shareable design tokens

stories.title: Template builder with editable zones
stories.description: Create the core template authoring experience where designers define locked and editable regions, inspired by Figma Buzz's approach to brand consistency.
acceptance: Canvas-based template editor with drag-and-drop
Define editable zones (text, image, color) vs locked zones
Set constraints per zone (character limits, image aspect ratios)
Preview template in Editor mode to test experience
Version history for template iterations
Import designs from Figma via copy-paste or API

stories.title: Simplified editor for marketing teams
stories.description: Build the guardrailed editing experience for non-designers to create on-brand content within template constraints.
acceptance: Template selection from workspace library
Edit only within defined editable zones
AI-powered text suggestions (rewrite, shorten, translate)
AI image generation within image zones
Real-time brand guideline validation
Preview across different platform sizes
One-click export to multiple formats

stories.title: Multi-model AI integration
stories.description: Integrate multiple AI providers for image, text, and video generation with model selection per task.
acceptance: Image generation via Flux, DALL-E, Stable Diffusion
Text generation via GPT-4, Claude for copy suggestions
Background removal and image enhancement
Style transfer to match brand aesthetics
Model selection dropdown per generation task
Usage tracking and credit management

stories.title: Bulk asset generation from data
stories.description: Enable spreadsheet-driven asset generation for marketing campaigns at scale, matching Figma Buzz's data mapping capability.
acceptance: CSV/Excel file upload with column detection
Visual column-to-template-zone mapping interface
Preview generated assets before batch creation
Generate hundreds of variants from single template
Export all variants as ZIP with naming convention
Save data source for re-generation with updates

stories.title: Platform preset library
stories.description: Pre-configured dimensions and export settings for major social and advertising platforms.
acceptance: Presets for Instagram (Feed, Story, Reels), Facebook, LinkedIn, X, YouTube, TikTok
Google Ads and Meta Ads format presets
One-click intelligent resize with content reflow
Platform-specific export optimization (compression, format)
Custom preset creation for unique use cases

stories.title: Real-time collaboration features
stories.description: Enable teams to work together on assets with presence, comments, and approval workflows.
acceptance: Real-time cursor presence showing active editors
Threaded comments anchored to specific elements
Approval workflow states (Draft, In Review, Approved)
Version comparison side-by-side
Activity feed showing recent changes
Slack/Teams notifications for approvals and comments

stories.title: Node-based workflow builder
stories.description: Advanced mode for power users to create reusable AI workflows, inspired by Weavy.ai's node architecture.
acceptance: Visual node canvas for workflow construction
AI model nodes (image gen, text gen, style transfer)
Transform nodes (resize, crop, color adjust)
Conditional logic nodes for dynamic outputs
Save workflows as reusable templates
App Mode to expose simplified UI from complex workflow

stories.title: Export and publishing
stories.description: Export assets in various formats with print-ready support addressing Figma Buzz's limitation.
acceptance: Export as PNG, JPG, WebP, SVG, PDF
CMYK color profile support for print
PDF export with bleed and crop marks
Direct publish to social platforms via API
Asset CDN for hosted image URLs
Batch export with custom naming conventions

stories.title: Asset performance analytics
stories.description: Track how generated assets perform when published to understand what content resonates.
acceptance: Track asset exports and publishes
Integration with social platform analytics
A/B variant performance comparison
Most-used templates dashboard
Team productivity metrics
Export analytics as CSV for reporting

target_segments: Marketing teams at companies using Figma who need self-serve asset creation
E-commerce companies with high-volume asset needs
Enterprise teams requiring brand governance at scale
differentiation: Unlike Figma Buzz: Full print-ready export capabilities (CMYK, bleed)
Unlike Weavy.ai: Brand-first architecture with governance built-in
Unlike Canva: Design system integration and professional workflows
Unlike Adobe Express: Simpler pricing, faster onboarding, multi-model AI

pricing_strategy.pro: $15/user/month - Unlimited exports, 3 brand kits, full AI
pricing_strategy.enterprise: Custom - SSO, audit logs, custom AI models, SLA
